intro: Lasianthus venosus, commonly known as the veiny lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent venation. Its small, tubular flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
